TextBlock.TextLine: mrico
In Antw: & may
Brussel John valo
mons Den ul van 28 pas met den geaccepteerde brief ontf
gesien ul ongelegen was mijnen tratos van ƒ300 te voldoen den t
eghter versoek te vereeren, en sal hver de selve weirden oft
soo veel als ue daertoe niet dernen en hem hal hier aen u t ordre
prompt voldoenrermits ul sijn gelt hier altijt noodich heeft
wat de baijen belanght, sal over komande ul deswegens contenteint
doen wegens de brusselse fabrigue hebbe onlanghs met dese
des verstaende gediscondeert & sijn all van eender opnee sal dat ck
twijffele oft sal leyken, eghter ul voor 2 stucken geni gageert
sijnde laandie salen toekomen ofte maer een volgens u selve
die onder terwijlen
In Antwerpen 2 maij 1688
Brugge Raphael Coots
mijnh. hebbe ul van 29 & 30 past, wel ontfangen geirne gesien dat Ant
Develaer wel is gepasseirt dae hul mentioneert niet van de 5 balen dew
ick meijne aen sijn boort te wesen, pieter willaert was gearriveert
verlange seer nae ul advies van heden hope met goet succes te vernemen
alhoewel ul lesten de sake soo onagebragiens maeck nochtans, soo ul
deperijkelen arivent bevint gelieft liver de sake te verclearen, want
boter washet bereghte te betalen als verlooren te gaen wat passert
verneme geirne, hebbende vanden in hout van M„N. 16 en d'ander
noch geen precies advies terwijlen
In Antwerpen 12 maij 1681
Turnhout Groltasar terstralen
mons. in antwoort aenden ul van gisteren sende hier boven de Rek vant
goet in mijn absentie aen ul verkoght & dehoe wel ick aen ul schudigh
sen, oock aengenomen hadde voor ul eenigh aestaen mons. Busselop
te betaelen nochtans endachte niet dat ƒ250: soude geweest
hebbe, & oock soo gepreseert contant nae demael maer weijnigh
dagente vooren al gelt had gegeven ick ben bereedt nu & dan
eenigh gelt te geven, maer ick en kan al seffere niet welsparsen
want het al lanck aen loopt alvoorens dat vande tijken afgeraken
en gelt bekomen, soo kan ul mons. butschop noch vooor eenigeging
tijt uijt stellen salt voldoen & noch van ul pertije, tijken verwachten
In Antwerp 3 maij 1681
London will Scawen
S. the 36: past sent you a note of het tor lane belonging to the kings yaght
of capt. faseby, by whom have sent a packett off lace N.2 which containes
as you will see by the inclosed invoyce, itt beeng don up & assorted toyds
order as neure as possible this I hope will sell well & putt off the rest
of which I desire you please to make adispatch they are noted asthey
really cost I hope itt will be with you about this time of which long to
know: now have before mee yd of 18 past have given you creditt for
my f share in our goods last shipt, which are aboatd peeter willaert
which is also well arrived butt I have no news yett if they be spost, oney
Antoni Develaere is on his way hether N.11 beeng past butt coots makes
the case mightye danyerous by his last yett I hope this day to und orstand
them past well I desire no goods more for this season & doubt the
mull mulles will not sell oneles very they be curious, & goods
for them of last yeare are not yett sold & soremaine
with kinde salues
In Antwerp 3 maij 1681
London Lcy knight Ley
t
S. my last to you was on the 26th past to which pleasedo be referred principally
about the 6N silver marck stuck cloathes, because I have undertaken todolivet
them here to our tesurts p very first, wherefore I exspect yd expedition in that
whist I perceane by yd of 15: past 2 bales with redd ape aboard omerd verscriek
for which have given you creditt, & seeng goods so Deare on yd side I must ain
the risico of the zea my self, or elee the proffitt will not bare itt
where fore I take these & bales for my acctt. & when you please to dispose of the
valw you may do itt, as also for what hence forward you might provide
more, returning you hearty thanckes for the care you please to thhe in
providing such goods for mee as please yd self, & ts you do loryd owne
could drisie my whose trade for my owne acctt: I should be very gladd
to be served by yd handes, butt ott can not verij wellehbbe forwant of so
great a stock as that trade requires, besides when I witte for goods I can
not well some times stay long for them as now had these reds been here
when I desired them first, they had been sold, where as towards Jane July
tis our dieadest time of the yeare for sselling butt this jattribute to yd
indisposition for which I am heartely sadrow, principally that yd agine
Doth not yett leave you, where as now tis the best season of ha
yeare to gett health which I do wilh you with all my kart as to the good
you sent from the north I found the bayes deaver then I had from others
because I had brought att the same time & die receaved with the same gessel
well 200 baijes more amonghst which severall of the RA &N you s hal
att 36 t & mince others did cost butt 33:6 whoever in. sijkes hath arberij
good mainnes of ordering his goods, & that comes from his handes shews
verij well as for the cloathes I fond them to content haveing onely to
say that they did not hold out their breath for they must befull ofay
brand withim the lists, or elce our people dotrot so much incline to bay
them inclosed you have pattarnes for a spack of Dosins & a pack fine ct
northrens which please to order him to provide accordingly to the inclosed
instructions to be shipt for Bruges: I am sold that he is avere ableman
that hath great bussynes & by whaat I finde if he mindes itt he may doitt
very well & so remaines with kinde saliuts
In Antwerp 3 maij 1681
London Henry maynard
th
3 my last to you was on the 26: past sence receaved yd of 18 ditto Antoni
Develaere with N.11 is past & here dayly exspected, pieter willard is nowatt
brugges, if them goods will pass also I know not as yett because mr.
coars doth make the buslynes so Icripuleos: I have given yo creditt
for the 2 packes of spanish cloathes which you have don well to ship
in 2 severall vessels to divert risico, the patturnes are all good, butt as
you say they will prove deared as, mee thinckes bij them also, yett
itt matters not in case I have them as cheap as others for wee be gune
to biing our customers to the prijses you will do well to gett the rest
of the in ordered spanish cloathes as well course as fine though couse
are the most wanting as in these N. 18 & 17 now shopt finde thats
N 641 „ 42 „ 43 do promise well N. 625 „ 630 „ 640 & 644 are not amis
& such culleurs will do in low prijses, and altought the 26: past
I have sent you yett an other instruction, amonght which there
is no draps cullours sonwerthaless you may not omitt to assort each
bale with att least 4 drap cullours or 5 & come more lress then in thtl
bales N. 18 & 17 some what after the inclosed patternes
which is one ofe om Antwarp fabrigue & you will dover houl aobt
now butt what will prove to yd content, for you have now a good season
& you may provide them att yd leasure our goods by which of ratterdam
ave now here & sold part of them princippally all the drapenelour
